dfischer.utils

Class SymmetricEncrypt

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.SymmetricEncrypt

  • public class SymmetricEncrypt
extends java.lang.Object
    A symmetric encryption library that is based on the 256-Bit Twofish algorithm.
    Since:
    V5.4-J

      • getEncryptContext

        public static SymmetricEncryptContext getEncryptContext(SymmetricEncryptContext oldContext)
                                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a new the context for encrypting and decrypting data based on an existing context. Note that the new context uses the same symmetric key and the same IV as the existing context.
        Parameters:
        oldContext - the existing (old) context for encrypting and decrypting data
        Returns:
        the existing new context for encrypting and decrypting data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

             byte[] plainData)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Encrypt data. Note that this method can be called only one time per encryptContext.
        Parameters:
        encryptContext - the context for encrypting and decrypting data
        plainData - the data to encrypt
        Returns:
        the encrypted data

      • encryptFile

        public static void encryptFile(java.io.File f,
               SymmetricEncryptContext encryptContext)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Encrypt a file by creating/using a new clone of the context for encrypting and decrypting data. Note that the file is replaced w/o creating a temporary file - by memory operations only. The non-encrypted file is read first fully into memory, then encrypted in memory, and then written back to to disk (overwritten) as an encrypted file.
        Parameters:
        f - the file to encrypt
        encryptContext - the context for encrypting and decrypting data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        Since:
        V5.5-B

      • decryptFile

        public static void decryptFile(java.io.File f,
               SymmetricEncryptContext encryptContext)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Decrypt a file by creating/using a new clone of the context for encrypting and decrypting data. Note that the file is replaced w/o creating a temporary file - by memory operations only. The encrypted file is read first fully into memory, then decrypted in memory, and then written back to to disk (overwritten) as a decrypted file.
        Parameters:
        f - the file to decrypt
        encryptContext - the context for encrypting and decrypting data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getDecryptedFileData

        public static byte[] getDecryptedFileData(java.io.File f,
                          SymmetricEncryptContext encryptContext)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the decrypted data of an encrypted file.
        Parameters:
        f - the file do decrypt
        encryptContext - the context for encrypting and decrypting data
        Returns:
        the decrypted data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
